definition: to settle an account
surname Fu
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
account/bill/debt/CL:本[ben3],筆|笔[bi3]
accounts payable

sentences.english: Haveing others pay your check is worth showing off, paying your own is worth proud of.
sentences.chinese: 男人付賬值得炫耀，但自己埋單那才叫驕傲。

sentences.english: The Ding Dafang acknowledgement, and pay leave.
sentences.chinese: 阿丁大方承認，並付賬走人。

sentences.english: Responsible for the management of accounts payables.
sentences.chinese: 負責應付賬款賬務管理。

sentences.english: The main part of the enterprise's accounts is accounts receivable and accounts payable.
sentences.chinese: 企業往來款的主要部分爲應收賬款和應付賬款。
會計或應付賬款相關知識。

sentences.english: Sit down with your accountant or bookkeeper to prioritize your payables.
sentences.chinese: 和您的會計師坐下來商談您的應付賬款。

sentences.english: He paid the pill by cashing in some bonds.
sentences.chinese: 他把一些證券兌換成現金付賬。

sentences.english: So we could owe money, and the best example that's account payable .
sentences.chinese: 應付賬款就是我們欠錢的最好的例子。

sentences.english: Please pay at the cash desk over there.
He pays by apex or with his amex card .
sentences.chinese: 他是用美國運通公司的信用卡付賬的。
應付賬款都記錄些什麼？

sentences.english: Business is business . You have to pay the bill.
sentences.chinese: 公事公辦，妳是要付賬的。

sentences.english: As I was paying the bill, Daniel came.
sentences.chinese: 在我付賬單時，丹尼爾趕過來了。

sentences.english: We don't have to pay anything. He said he would foot the entire bill.
sentences.chinese: 我們不必付賬，他說全由他埋單。

sentences.english: You can pay the bill with a cheque if you like.
sentences.chinese: 如果你願意，可以用支票付賬。

definition: debt of gratitude
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
see 賒賬|赊账[she1 zhang4]
IOU/informal document acknowledging a debt
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
When you enter a country, follow the local customs (idiom); do as the natives do/When in Rome, do as the Romans do
to place an order (commerce)
to make fun of/to seek diversion
reckless/extremely daring
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to get straight to the point (idiom)
excuse me (i.e. let me through, please)
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
